Package main

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
main.Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
The Controller class which controls the whole application and the only way from which we can interact with the Renderer class through the main method.
Author:
Timothy
See Also:
Driver

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Camera camera  
    private Image image  
    private Options options  
    private Renderer renderer  
    private Scene scene  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Controller()
    Create a new Controller object which also creates an Options object with default parameters.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void initializeCamera()
    The initializeCamera method creates a new Camera object which takes the Scene's static ORIGIN variable as it's position, a Vector3D target (lookAt), a Vector3D targetUpGuide, a fieldOfView and an aspectRatio which are both specified in the Options object.
    private void initializeImage()
    The private initialize Image method creates a new Image object with the width and height specified in the Options object as its constructor arguments.
    void initializeRenderer()
    A method which initializes an Image object, a Scene object and a Camera object, so that a Renderer object can be created with a Camera and Scene object that it needs as constructor arguments.
    private void initializeScene()
    The initializeScene method creates a new Scene object after which it calls the Scene's add method which accepts any object that extends the abstract SceneObject class.
    void startRenderer()
    The startRenderer function calls the render method of the renderer object and passes the initialized Image object as an argument to it.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()
      Create a new Controller object which also creates an Options object with default parameters.
      See Also:
      Options

  • Method Details

    • initializeRenderer

      public void initializeRenderer()
      A method which initializes an Image object, a Scene object and a Camera object, so that a Renderer object can be created with a Camera and Scene object that it needs as constructor arguments.
      See Also:
      Image, Scene, Camera

    • initializeImage

      private void initializeImage()
      The private initialize Image method creates a new Image object with the width and height specified in the Options object as its constructor arguments.
      See Also:
      Image, Options

    • initializeScene

      private void initializeScene()
      The initializeScene method creates a new Scene object after which it calls the Scene's add method which accepts any object that extends the abstract SceneObject class. It adds a few geometries and two lights.
      See Also:
      Scene, SceneObject, Sphere, Plane, Light

    • initializeCamera

      private void initializeCamera()
      The initializeCamera method creates a new Camera object which takes the Scene's static ORIGIN variable as it's position, a Vector3D target (lookAt), a Vector3D targetUpGuide, a fieldOfView and an aspectRatio which are both specified in the Options object.
      See Also:
      Camera, Vector3D, Options

    • startRenderer

      public void startRenderer()
      The startRenderer function calls the render method of the renderer object and passes the initialized Image object as an argument to it.
      See Also:
      Renderer
